text: Robin Henry Seymour (March 8, 1926 â€“ April 17, 2020) was an American radio personality and disc jockey. He worked at CKLW and WKMH. He was also the host of the television series Teen Town and Swingin' Time. He was one of the country's longest-serving top ten disc jockeys. Seymour was born in Detroit, Michigan. Seymour died in San Antonio, Texas on April 17, 2020, at the age of 94.Detroit radio, TV personality Robin Seymour dies at 94 WDIV, April 17, 2020 ==References== Category:People from Detroit Category:American radio personalities Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths
title: Robin Seymour (DJ)
